page.title: 04A Day in Sarah Cobbe's Life
page.content: to eleven. We come in and carry on with{English}until eleven. Then we do {Maths}altogether and{Mr. Barrett writes on the blackboard with some chalk. It is usually about{Percentages or{Fractions.}On a Thursday we do Maths until thirty minutes past eleven. We go for dinner. We wash our hands and go in the hall. We have sandwich tables and dinner tables. We first have a prayer then we eat. The dinner ladies serve the meals for the dinner tables. Then it's playtime and {Mrs. Sullivan}and{Mrs. Hadley}comes out to watch us. Then at one o'clock we line up the same way as we came in. We then, class three girls and a class two girl go in and get our{swimming gear and we go to the coach. The boys also line up. Class three and class two go and get their gear. Then we get on the coach. The swimming baths that
